  TIMER_RX_ACK

  EV_BROADCAST_RECEIVED, EV_TIMER_CCA
}
 

MAC state machine events. See state diagram.

Detailed Description

Generic CSMA Mac-Layer.

Supports constant, linear and exponential backoffs as well as MAC ACKs.

Author:
Jerome Rousselot, Amre El-Hoiydi, Marc Loebbers, Yosia Hadisusanto, Andreas Koepke
Karl Wessel (port for MiXiM)

CSMA Mac-Layer - finite state machine

Definition at line 57 of file csma.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum csma::backoff_methods [protected]

The different back-off methods.

Enumerator:
CONSTANT 

Constant back-off time.

LINEAR 

Linear increasing back-off time.

EXPONENTIAL 

Exponentially increasing back-off time.

void csma::handleLowerMsg ( cMessage *  msg  )  [virtual]

Handle messages from lower layer.

Compares the address of this Host with the destination address in frame. Generates the corresponding event.

Reimplemented from BaseMacLayer.

00757   {
00758     if(!useMACAcks) {
00759       debugEV << "Received a data packet addressed to me." << endl;
00760 //      nbRxFrames++;
00761       executeMac(EV_FRAME_RECEIVED, macPkt);

00765 
00766       if(strcmp(macPkt->getName(), "CSMA-Ack") != 0) {
00767         // This is a data message addressed to us
00768         // and we should send an ack.
00769         // we build the ack packet here because we need to
00770         // copy data from macPkt (src).

00772            << " preparing an ack..." << endl;
00773 
00774 //        nbRxFrames++;
00775 
00776         if(ackMessage != NULL)

00780         ackMessage->setDestAddr(macPkt->getSrcAddr());
00781         ackMessage->setBitLength(ackLength);
00782         //Check for duplicates by checking expected seqNr of sender
00783         if(SeqNrChild.find(src) == SeqNrChild.end()) {
00784           //no record of current child -> add expected next number to map
00785           SeqNrChild[src] = SeqNr + 1;
00786           debugEV << "Adding a new child to the map of Sequence numbers:" << src << endl;
00787           executeMac(EV_FRAME_RECEIVED, macPkt);
00788         }
00789         else {
00790           ExpectedNr = SeqNrChild[src];
00791           debugEV << "Expected Sequence number is " << ExpectedNr <<
00792           " and number of packet is " << SeqNr << endl;
00793           if(SeqNr < ExpectedNr) {
00794             //Duplicate Packet, count and do not send to upper layer
00795             nbDuplicates++;
00796             executeMac(EV_DUPLICATE_RECEIVED, macPkt);
00797           }
00798           else {
00799             SeqNrChild[src] = SeqNr + 1;
00800             executeMac(EV_FRAME_RECEIVED, macPkt);
00801           }
00802         }
00803 
00804       } else if(macQueue.size() != 0) {
00805 
00806         // message is an ack, and it is for us.
00807         // Is it from the right node ?
00808         MacPkt * firstPacket = static_cast<MacPkt *>(macQueue.front());
00809         if(macPkt->getSrcAddr() == firstPacket->getDestAddr()) {
00810           nbRecvdAcks++;
00811           executeMac(EV_ACK_RECEIVED, macPkt);
00812         } else {
00813           EV << "Error! Received an ack from an unexpected source: src=" << macPkt->getSrcAddr() << ", I was expecting from node addr=" << firstPacket->getDestAddr() << endl;
00814           delete macPkt;
00815         }
00816       } else {
00817         EV << "Error! Received an Ack while my send queue was empty. src=" << macPkt->getSrcAddr() << "." << endl;
00818         delete macPkt;
00819       }
00820     }
00821   }
00822   else if (LAddress::isL2Broadcast(dest)) {
00823     executeMac(EV_BROADCAST_RECEIVED, macPkt);
00824   } else {
00825     debugEV << "packet not for me, deleting...\n";
00826     delete macPkt;
00827   }
00828 }

void csma::handleUpperMsg ( cMessage *  msg  )  [virtual]

Handle messages from upper layer.

Encapsulates the message to be transmitted and pass it on to the FSM main method for further processing.

Reimplemented from BaseMacLayer.

void csma::initialize ( int  stage  )  [virtual]

Initialization of the module and some variables.

Initialize the of the omnetpp.ini variables in stage 1. In stage two subscribe to the RadioState.

Reimplemented from BaseMacLayer.

Reimplemented in CSMA802154.

Member Data Documentation

simtime_t csma::sifs [protected]

Maximum time between a packet and its ACK.

Usually this is slightly more then the tx-rx turnaround time The channel should stay clear within this period of time.

Definition at line 232 of file csma.h.

Referenced by initialize().

unsigned int csma::txAttempts [protected]

count the number of tx attempts

This holds the number of transmission attempts for the current frame.
